question_text: Which scenario most likely indicates a failed locking mechanism in a DisplayPort connection?
answer_options: Video signal intermittently cuts out after slight cable movement
Resolution drops below 1080p on a 4K monitor
Audio output fails to pass through to HDMI speakers
System BIOS fails to detect the monitor on cold boot
correct_answer: Video signal intermittently cuts out after slight cable movement
explanation: A damaged or disengaged DisplayPort locking latch may allow the connector to loosen, causing an unstable connection and signal loss during minor cable movement.
